metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Psalm 130: The Depth of Sin and the Radiance of Love

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is fundamentally 'miserable' and incapable of self-rescue from the 'vast primordial catastrophe' of sin.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Inner core of being)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
the church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit (Fellowship/Pouring out)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
the love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tekstueel_bewijs: our total inability to present ourselves righteous
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as an ontological 'catastrophe' and 'impulse toward self-destruction' that renders the human subject powerless.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as an entrance into the larger life of God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Psalmist
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Honesty and Worship (Fear of the Lord)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (confession) is explicitly triggered by the primary program (God's forgiveness). 'There is forgiveness with you; therefore you shall be feared.'

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave.
The love of God bears all things.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself.

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything... to reverse the situation
if we can only begin to understand
total inability to present ourselves righteous
God who can redeem humanity from so grave a predicament

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Non-Pouvoir-Faire' (inability) of the human subject and the 'Pouvoir-Faire' (sovereign power) of God's grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Depths' (S2) to the realization of 'No Health' (~S1), then to the 'Forgiveness' (S1) which enables 'Fear/Honesty' (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Subject-switch': God does for the human what the human cannot do for themselves.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects moralism ('petty record keeping') and places the agency of salvation entirely on the Triune God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
there is no health in us

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human love is used as a 'hint' or 'glimmer' (analogy), not as a model to be imitated to earn salvation.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Paul (as an example of agony, not a hero to copy)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul's love is a reflection of God's prior love.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: salvation is a work of God received by man.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the 'depth' of the human condition with the 'height' of the Trinitarian blessing.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'miserable offender' and 'beloved child'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the 'pouring forth' of God's own life into the believer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'impulse toward self-destruction' and a 'catastrophe'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is robustly theocentric. God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in the 'Grammar of Grace'. It refuses to let the human subject become the hero of the story, even in the act of confession.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the parental pathos, semiotics reveals that the parent is merely a functional placeholder for the 'Sender' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'charis'; Greimas shows how 'charis' functions as the 'Object' given by the 'Subject' (God) to the 'Receiver' (Man).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'Fear of the Lord' is not a 'Devoir' (Law) but a 'Savoir' (Wisdom) resulting from the 'Object' (Forgiveness) being received.

appendices.notities: The sermon utilizes Fleming Rutledge's own homiletical style, which explains the high Rutledge Score.
